definition: to turn pale at the mention of a tiger (idiom)/to be scared at the mere mention of
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
surname Tan
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
color/dice
color/CL:種|种[zhong3]/look/appearance/sex
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: Syphilis was the most feared of venereal diseases.
sentences.chinese: 梅毒是最让人谈虎色变的一种性传播疾病。

sentences.english: There is a disease that makes them scared, and that is AIDS.
sentences.chinese: 这当中就有一种疾病让人谈虎色变，那就是艾滋病。

sentences.english: People turn pale at the mere mention of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 一提起癌，人们便谈虎色变。

sentences.english: Those bear markets have left many investors reluctant to buy stocks at all.
sentences.chinese: 这两个熊市已经让投资者对股票谈虎色变。

sentences.english: To student online turn pale at the only mention of sth terrible, this is unscientific.
sentences.chinese: 对学生上网谈虎色变，这是不科学的。

definition: hear the wind and lose gall (idiom); terror-stricken at the news
intimidate at the first glance (idiom); awe-inspiring/terrifying/overwhelming
to feel intimidated
to tremble with fear (idiom)/scared witless
panic-stricken
panic-stricken/scared out of one's wits
lit. every tree or bush an enemy soldier (idiom); fig. to panic and treat everyone as an enemy/to feel beleaguered
lit. to see a bow reflected in a cup as a snake (idiom); fig. unnecessary suspicions/overly fearful
lit. to retreat three day's march (idiom); fig. to give way in the face of superior strength/a strategic withdrawal
lit. severe floods and fierce beasts (idiom)/fig. great scourges/extremely dangerous or threatening things
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
lit. a bird startled by the mere twang of a bow (idiom)/fig. sb who frightens easily, due to past experiences
notorious (idiom)/infamous
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
to fear/to be terrified
to detest bitterly (idiom)/implacable hatred/to abhor/anathema
